reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Support the creation, improvement and sustainability of physical infrastructure, and related services, in both urban and rural areas, to enhance the economic environment and improve economic productivity, including for women. The main infrastructures include energy, including electric power transmission lines and distribution networks, oil/gas terminals, refineries, storage facilities and pipelines; telecom and ICT; and transport, including roads, airports, railways, and ports.

This award supports the creation, improvement and sustainability of physical infrastructure, and related services, in both urban and rural areas, to enhance the economic environment and improve economic productivity, including for women,. More specifically, this award includes a USTDA funding is supporting a series of six (6) Southeast Asia Aviation Workshops to provide a broad range of managerial, technical, safety, efficiency, capacity, and operational training to key officials from civil aviation authorities, airport management groups, air navigation providers, and individual airport operators in Southeast Asia. The workshops serve as a forum where representatives from U.S. industry and government engage Southeast Asian counterparts to collaborate on best practices, standards, and policy development for the region's aviation industry.. USTDA funding is supporting a series of six (6) Southeast Asia Aviation Workshops to provide a broad range of managerial, technical, safety, efficiency, capacity, and operational training to key officials from civil aviation authorities, airport management groups, air navigation providers, and individual airport operators in Southeast Asia. The workshops serve as a forum where representatives from U.S. industry and government engage Southeast Asian counterparts to collaborate on best practices, standards, and policy development for the region's aviation industry. This funding in the amount of $177,922 is being added to the Southeast Asia Aviation Workshop Series, bringing the new total of funding to $866,922. The funding in the amount of $182,598 is being added to the Southeast Asia Aviation Workshop Series to cover the travel costs for up to ten Southeast Asian aviation representatives to attend each of the six separate and distinct workshops, and to add a networking reception to each workshop. In addition, this memorandum allows USTDA to invite likeminded country representatives to participate in the workshops to advance regional aviation cooperation in Southeast Asia..
